Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: slowdiver
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, well placed for the Bastille area (which has lots of good restaurants and bars). Clean, well decorated, very comfortable beds and very helpful staff. Paris is never quiet, but this wasn't too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “not really a new hotel but its OK”
Reviews.Author: 540willk
Reviews.Content: Mercure advertise this as a new hotel - the St Antoine - opening January 2012 but the renovations have been limited. By comparison the Mercure Paris Voltaire, Bastille Quartier, really is a new hotel: it has been fully refurbished and offers a very different experience. The St Antoinne (still marketed as the Paname) does not meet this standard. But it is clean and the staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: JOANNEMC
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 14 yr old son on a sightseeing, getaway trip - Feb 2012. We found the hotel relatively easy with the help of the GPS on my phone - it is a short walk away from the Ledru Rollin metro station on line 8. The staff were really friendly and helpful - sorted all our needs out and couldnt do enough for us. The room was lovely - it had two single beds in, a wall mounted flat screen telly, a wee table with T&C making facilities on and a very modern en suite bathroom with lovely toiletries, a hairdryer and wall mounted magnified shaving mirror. There was wardrobe space with hangers provided AND a free of charge safe, perfect for our passports and valuables. The room itself was very tastefully decorated with double sliding patio type doors, shutters AND thick black curtains - perfect if you want a lie in! - but theres so much to see and do, who would want to lie in?? There are other reviews about the room being small, but what do you want to do in it - there was plenty of room for us two and our luggage - no problem at all. A walk slightly beyond Ledru Rollin metro is the Bastille metro (line 5) and the Bastille itself - loads and loads of cafes bars and restaurants. Looks lovely at night, all lit up. Pick up a map from the hotel reception and walk around the city - we saw lots and lots - tiring but great fun. We had also booked a City Segway Tour online before we went (£70 each) - what a fantastic laugh that was - saw loads more of the city in a fun way - worth every penny!! i would like to recommend an Italian restaurant a very short walk away (5mins) from the hotel. Its called Dell Isola and is on the rue du Faubourg st Antoine. Very good value for money, tasty big portions and really friendly staff. There is an amazing patisserie on the end of the street from the hotel - croissants and pastries to die for if you dont take brekkie in the hotel - we didnt, we just did our own thing. And of course there is a McDonalds nearby, just past the Ledru Rollin metro if you prefer that. We had a fantastic stay in Paris and having this lovely, warm, friendly hotel to go back to made our stay even better. Thank you - i will recommend it to friends and i hope anyone who goes there has a positive stay like us. (booked online with Venere.com 250 euros for 2 of us for 2 nights - i thought this was okay for the Bastille area of Paris).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very clean, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sonja f
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. The room was clean and comfortable, internet was complimentary and the staff were very friendly. The room was reasonably priced and in a good location for getting around the city (particularly to the Marais and Bastille area). Many restaurants nearby and a short walk to the metro. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a quick visit”
Reviews.Author: LizAndNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late September for three nights. It is not in the heart of the tourist area but is relatively easy to find from the Gare De Lyon, although closer to the Ledru-Rollins metro station. The two rooms for our party were spotlessly clean but there is no denying that they are very small. The decor could do with a refresh, especially the carpets. However, this is outweighed by a reasonable (by Paris standards) price and helpful, friendly staff who spoke enough English for us to get by. There is a rooftop terrace where we breakfasted each morning on croissants and pain chocolat from the boulangerie literally two minutes away and enjoyed a sun-downer after a hard day's sight-seeing. The local market is bursting with fresh foods, adjacent to this is a nice supermarket for basic supplies. Lots of local restaruants to take your pick from for evening meals. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: tonyusher
Reviews.Content: This was my 12th time in Paris and we decided to "go local" Normally stay on Left Bank around Rue de Bac (still love that area) but this little gem of a hotel had everything we needed and in a wonderful old part of the city. So close to Place de Vosges, the Bastille and Marais areas (very old part of Paris), we even walked to Champs Elyssees from here. We took a Terrace room (recommended as the rooms are small but very clean and functional). Sitting out early mornings and late evenings was a delight and we enjoyed the late September Indian summer. Hotel staff were very efficient and friendly, every recommendation was excellent, especially the restaurant at the end of the adjacent laneway (L'ebeauchoir - we ate there 3 nights - so good). Not a touristy area and we found ourselves conversing with the locals who were all wonderfully friendly and hepful. for breakfast, try La Chat Bossu (translates something like the Bent Cat or Hunchback Cat - everything super fresh!). Each morning we found a fresh farmers' market about 30 metres from our hotel door anf an abundance of great cafes and eateries. Also very close to the Theatre Main d'Or where you must catch the brilliantly funny show "How to be a Parisian in One Hour". Olivier is bringing this one man stand up routine to Melbourne for the 2012 Comedy Festival and it will be a huge hit for sure. Hilarious (and 99% in English so easy to understand - but definitely not for under 15's).

Reviews.Title: “Good location - decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonashomaa
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a balcony which was nice cause we could sit out at night and relaxed with a cold bottle of wine while our daughter slept. Rooms are quite small but decent. Location is good if you are coming in or leaving from Gare du Lyon. The area is very nice if you like local markets, shops and restaurants. Would go there again. Nothing very fancy though - reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug419
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paname Hotel Bastille the last 2 days of July and were very pleased with the accommodations. It is located just a 5 minute walk from the Ledru-Rollins metro station on Line 8 in a nice, quiet residential district. It's a funkily decorated place with a lot of character - think an updated 70's look! We took the Roissybus to Le Opéra. It was about an 8 minute walk to the Opéra metro station and maybe a 10-12 minute metro ride to Ledru-Rollins. The check-in was good and as we arrived fairly early we were fully prepared to be told we'd have to wait for our room to be ready. Luckily, they had a room ready for us when we arrived. The room was comfortable and quiet and the facilities were clean. The WiFi is free and worked well. The bathroom had a shower and tub which was nice. There is a rooftop terrace that was perfect for sharing a glass of wine as the sun is setting after a day of sight-seeing .The staff was helpful with restaurant recommendations and were good about any requests we had. Two blocks away is a daily morning market that is fun to poke around. The price was great by Paris standards and I would recommend this hotel unreservedly. I hope it will become my go-to hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Really funky little hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkeyman07
Reviews.Content: Best of both worlds really - it was offset from the main drag of rue faubourg st antoine so nice and quiet (although I should stress it was the middle of August when things are generally quieter in Paris), yet only 5-10 mins walk from all the fun at Place Bastille. The staff were very friendly and efficient, the hotel is kitted out very funky without being tacky, the room was clean and the bathroom well stocked with plenty of towels and condiments, even a complimentary bottle of water, which was just what I needed after a 15 minute walk with my bags from Gare de Lyon. You can obviously get a taxi and it's a 3 minute drive but i just like walking everywhere! The shower was terrific - good pressure and the bath itself nice and big if you want to take a load off, the bed and pillows in my double room was really comfy I slept very well both nights. Tv was the usual rubbish but it worked if you're bothered with it, I wasn't, the room wasn't huge but a decent size with enough space to do a few sit-ups and push-ups if you're into that sort of thing! Breakfast - continental - self service cereal and jams and boiled eggs etc and you get brought a basket of bread and a large croissant. Decent without being spectacular. Location-wise it's really well placed to get everywhere without being in the expensive part of town, and there's even a nice roof terrace to chill and read a book or plan your day. I didn't try the restaurant next door but it was full both nights so seemed popular so seemed popular. Overall I really enjoyed my stay and will definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: HundenLeifen
Reviews.Content: In short: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the Paname Hotel in the summer of 2010 and had a great stay. The best feature of the hotel was the amazing staff! They weren't just super friendly but also very helpful and very service minded. They really took their time to help us and made our stay great! The hotel itself is smallish and cousy and perfect for couples. All in all, a super experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kastrullhaxan
Reviews.Content: The air-condition was worth everything when Paris was extremely hot when we arrived. Relaxing at the roomterrace with fruit and cheese was a perfect end of a day in the bustling city and a perfect start in the morning, the room had waterheater so we could make coffe. The room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. Location was perfect close to metro and a lovely foodmarket with very reasonable prices compared to other areas in Paris ..

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay at the Paname”
Reviews.Author: cristinablendea
Reviews.Content: We had booked a hotel in Montmartre first, but due to renovation work we were transferred to the Paname Hotel Bastille a couple of weeks before our trip to Paris. My first impression of the Paname was good since I first emailed to make sure the transfer was OK and we really had a place to stay since it was all already paid for - I got a nice reply right away! The hotel is situated on a relatively quiet street and the two closest metro stops are Ledru-Rollin and Faidherbe Chaligny. The walk to the Bastille isn't too long either, should one prefer that. The neighborhood is typically Parisian, with shops, cafés, restaurants, pharmacies and even one or two lively, colorful markets. We arrived at around 12 noon and were told that check-in started at 1 pm. That info wasn't really clear on the website and not on Hotels.com either, so keep in mind to show up after 1 o'clock. Our room was very nice, situated on the first floor, with a view towards the street. It was clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. We had a big bathroom with a bathtub, hairdryer and fresh, clean towels. The toilet itself was in a smaller separate section. The bed was large, clean and comfortable, with a lot of pillows. There was a kettle and tea, coffee and milk at our disposal, free of charge, as well as wireless internet connection, also free of charge. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but it's available for an extra amount and there is also a bar. We didn't spend much time on the rooftop terrace either, but we checked it out and it was nice. The only real complaint I have is that their booking system doesn't seem to work properly and check-out is such a big deal. We were "unlucky" enough to have to check-out early in the morning, and the male receptionist wasn't able to find our booking and he couldn't see it was all already paid for. He was going to charge us for parking as well, although we never booked that since we don't have a car. Make sure to print a receipt once you book, especially if you book through another site than the hotel's, and point out the evening before that you intend to check-out in the morning. The rest of the staff was very friendly and helpful, they spoke both English and French and I think a couple of them even speak Spanish. We needed a pharmacy on a Sunday, when most are closed, and we were given helpful directions at the front desk. I would have rated the overall experience as "Very good" but the check-out complications were a bit stressful, thus the "Average" rating. However, we did have a pleasant stay and I would definitely stay there again, if I got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Petite Room”
Reviews.Author: Carmen050
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because my daughter and her friend wanted to be near an area where the local would frequent at night. The location was great and it was close to many restaurants and bars. The hotel itself was very small, and the rooms were smaller than what I expected. We were only two and it was hard to walk with our luggage on top of the chairs because we had no other place to put it. At night while my daugher and friend went out, and I stayed in the room the channels on the TV in the room had much to be desired. I had 2 news channels in English CNN & BCC and others in French and two in Spanish which kept repeating the same program over an over. One good thing I was aware of the Japan & Lybia situation 24/7. The staff was very nice but with very little knowledge of restaurants in the area that they could recommend. I have never been to a hotel where the staff can't recommend restaurants in the area except for the one across the street. The internet was very slow so if you need to read your e-mails for work like I had to since my trip was partially business mixed with pleasure so forget it. Very frustrating. When back in Paris I will not be staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: EntrepreneurGal
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 6 night stay in the perfect neighbourhood - safe, very clean, and only a 15 min stroll to either Bastille Metro stop and Gare du Lyon. Staff was always friendly and personable. Probably the only small complaint is that Wifi was very erratic which was inconvenient. Location was great, market and patissierie were just down the street! Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: pken111
Reviews.Content: Paname is a gem. It is reasonably appointed for a three star. It has incredibly friendly staff. It has great breakfasts. And it is in one of the hippest precincts in Paris. All around are great restaurants, wine bars and one of the best street markets in Paris (Aligre). We have stayed at Paname twice now, and have found the rooms comfortable (if tiny - but bigger than many 3 stars rooms) and well insulated against the street noise. A great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel for the price, close to the subway”
Reviews.Author: frombgtony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Paname in December 2010-January 2011 for New Years Eve. Everyone was really nice and helpful although we were not really demanding guests. The room was small but clean, cozy, and warm in the winter, which was very important for me. The bathrooms are nice and new. The bedding and the towels get replaced everyday. Don't get their breakfast because Paris is a city of cafe's. Try the Creperie Bretonne Fleurie very close to the hotel for amazing, very Parisian crepes. The subway ride is about 4, 5 stops to the Louvre which was great. We mostly took the 1 as it goes to most sights, but that is a short walk to Place de Bastille. The subway is great in Paris so it wasn't a problem to get around but at night the closest station was closed so you do have to walk Place de Bastille to get around. But it was fine even in the cold. Recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Homely”
Reviews.Author: darrypars
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paname hotel in june this year along with my wife and baby daughter for four nights. The travel to the hotel was uneventful as we travelled by cab from the airport and the first sight was a little unnerving as it looked a wee bit jaded from the outside. We reached early for our reservation, but the dear lady at the reception gave us an area to store our bags safely while we went for a short walk to explore the neighbourhood. The location was great 7-8mins walk to the bastille and the seine and just a minute walk to the subway. A farmers market in the opposite street made this as close to home as possible. The room was small but very clean with nice touches including ta huge picture of a maharaja!!The cleanliness was very well mantained over the next 4 days and that was great. We did not opt for the breakfast there as there were three bakeries and three cheese stores in a minutes radius. We had some great sushi and french cuisine in the restaurants nearby. The best part was the service of a free laptop which the reception provided for web browsing using the free wifi. this is the first time i have come across this amenity and must say it iwas wonderful There was a general strike in france on the day of our departure and that led to our booked Taxi bailing out at the nth hour. The gentleman at the reception took this on as a personal mission ans relentlessly worked the phones till we had a taxi to the airport with a delay of only 20 minutes. nice hotel and loved the experience though it was a litlle pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sunl0ver78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paname Hotel for 5 nights. We were initially a bit apprehensive on seeing the exterior after arriving in Paris, but our concerns quickly dissipated when we saw our room. It was not big, but was bright spotless clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was beautiful and clean, and the bed was the most comfortable we've slept in - better than our own bed at home! Because we were staying there for 5 nights, breakfast was included in our rates (100 euro). It was always served with a smile, and was the most enjoyable breakfast during our holiday. We were able to borrow a laptop from the reception staff to use the internet, which was a real bonus. The metro was 5-7 mins walk, and it was definitely the best way to see Paris. This hotel was a real surprise and I couldn't have been happier with our choice. Would definitely come back here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hisbonnielass
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 8 nights at La Paname and can't say enough about it. No plans to travel back to Paris again anytime soon, however I can guarantee that if I do go back, I will stay here again. Staff was all very nice and helpful and most spoke english. Room was small (but they all are in Paris), very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Rooms were very quite - never heard anything from the hall or other rooms. Highly recommend the 4th floor rooms with the terrace. Stopping at the local market and picking up ham, cheese, pate, fruit was fabulous - no frig in the room, but the hotel was kind enough to store our fresh goodies for us. After a long day of site seeing, pick up a fresh warm baguette and a bottle of wine. The hotel will give you plates, silverware, etc and you can have the most enjoyable little picnic on your private terrace! Not a tourist area, so the local restaurants are very parisian - and fabulous! Metro just a few minute walk so travels to anywhere in Paris was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay there next time we are in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Vi_rejser_gerne
Reviews.Content: Absolute a nice hotel and the staff were very kind and helpful. The area is quiet - and the surroundings are nice. We have been is Paris 5-6 times - and this hotel is the best ever! Even there were workers during daytime – we hardly felt it. We will love to go back and see the rest of the refurbish. Also the breakfast was a lot better than we have seen before, coffee, tea, croissant, baguette, cheese, marmalade, yoghurt, boiled egg and cornflakes etc. and an excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Bigger than expected”
Reviews.Author: jenny99CalgaryCanada
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was American size with good size bathroom (shower and bidet) and the toilet was in its own room. Free wireless internet connection in room and hotel lends you a laptop. Excellent continental breakfast, terrace on roof for coffee and drinks, and friendly helpful staff who spoke English. About 3 minute walk to Metro and minutes to local market and shops. I felt safe in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel, convenient and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller67
Reviews.Content: I booked online for 6 nights for 100 euros per night for 6 nights breakfas included. I must say it was a pleasant stay. It was in a quiet area. The room is nothing special and toiletries were very basic, but the bed was very comfortable, large window with steel shutters allowed you to control the amount of natural lights. Carpet was old and stained but room is very clean. We got a great sleep every night. Breakfast was lovely with pastry, bread, cereal, fruits, ham and cheese. The staff were great, most of them spoke good English. They also allowed you to use their lap top to access the internet free of charge which is an added bonus. Surrounding areas were convenient. Morning market is just outside with a supermarket with in about 300 metres walking. Metro is about 1 km walk. I would stay there again if I was visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Relais de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: dreamaway
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I had a spacious room with a large window, and a very comfortable bed! The staff were very pleasant, especially one man (whose name I unfortunately don't know), who spoke excellent English, offered lots of assistance, and even ran around the reception trying to find me an umberella when it was raining one morning. The location is very convenient. It's about a 10 or 15 minute walk to the Gare de Lyon, and there are shops, bakeries, supermarkets and restaurants nearby. I hope to return to Paris in the near future, and I will definitely be staying there again!

HotelInfo.Name: Paname Hotel Bastille
HotelInfo.Address: 64 Rue Crozatier, 75012 Paris, France
